hecr
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • hecr Tutorial

Reference version 0.1.0

All functions

add_to_corpus

Add specified file to an existing corpus

append_meta

Function appends to an existing ts1 or ts2 dataframe with the data queried from hec_metadata

close_corpus

Safely close a corpus

create_hdf_corpus

Build a corpus of hdf files to execute queries on. This function has been deprecated use hec_file2() instead

extract_ts1

Function queries an hdf file read in with hec_file for cross section time series data.

extract_ts2

Function extracts a time series from 2D portion of hec ras model.

get_model_timestamps

Function retrieves the timestamps defined in the HEC-RAS model run

get_plan_attributes

Function retrieves model attributes embeded in a HEC-RAS result file.

get_xs_river_stations

Function returns cross section stations defined in the model

hdf_paths

Constants point to location on the hdf5 file

hec_config

Function reads in and fills in a query based on a configuration file parameter

hec_file

Function reads in either a single hdf file or a collection of these specified as arguments.

hec_metadata

Function takes in a hec file or a collection of these and forms a metadata dataframe from them.

new_config

Create a new configuration file can be used to automate alot of the work done by the hecr package.

Contents

  • All functions
